comments:
driver: 	TPTP-4.3.0-200609200100
reproduce step:
1. check out org.eclipse.hyades.logging.core.tests from test results/platform
2. click run-> run..., create a new test configuration
3. select org.eclipse.hyades.logging.core.tests in test pane
It will freeze the eclipse. Finally an OutOfMemoryError is thrown.

I am aso experiencing this defect and it happens for me (always) with the org.eclipse.hyades.logging.core.tests plugin selection as well as with other selections for Junit tests intermittently.
Reassign to Platform.Agents.Logging.  This appears to be a logging problem rather than a Test.UI problem.

Mark, this is a problem when the user creates a launch configuration for a test cased by 

java.lang.OutOfMemoryError
at java.lang.StringBuffer.toString(StringBuffer.java:916)
at com.ibm.icu.impl.ICUResourceBundleImpl$ResourceTable.getKey(ICUResourceBundleImpl.java:277)

Please investigate an ICU issue with the Eclipse platform.
Reassign to Jerome.  He handles launch config problems.

I am running into another problem which I think is related but it is intermittent. I was previously running auto GUI tests in my workspace and then I went to set up a new launch configuration for a Junit test suite and I get the error message below. I am now not able to create a new Test launch configuration or edit an existing one. It seems to be related to what is described below and the problem is only occurring intermittently. This is also using the TPTP-4.3.0-200609200100 driver.
